```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
data<-read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jpaje95/STA6233_FinalProject/main/stats1.csv")
library(shiny)
library(rmarkdown)
library(plotly)

cr <- list(
  title = "Critic Ratings",
  showticklabels = FALSE,
  showgrid = FALSE)
```
## Looking for a new game to play? 
With the increasingly rapid growth of technology, the video game industry has been on the rise with both additions to classic series and also new franchises for players of all skill level and experience to enjoy. Organized by genre and style of gameplay, below are some of the most popular video games of this generation. Please feel free to click around and see what kind of games might be up your alley! 

# Racing {.tabset .tabset-fade}

## **Mario Kart 8**
![](https://cdn02.nintendo-europe.com/media/images/10_share_images/games_15/wiiu_14/SI_WiiU_MarioKart8_image1600w.jpg)

### {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills}
#### Summary
Mario Kart 8 is a popular racing game published by Nintendo. The game allows up to eight players in a friendly competition that tests each player’s racing skills. It follows the classic Mario Kart gameplay from the series where players control Mario franchise characters in kart racing, collecting a variety of items to hinder opponents, and gain advantages in the race. 

```{r mariokartsum, echo = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
rank = 1
info <- data[rank, c(2,3,15)]
consoles<- data[rank, c(4:7)]
knitr::kable(info, caption = "Additional Info")
knitr::kable(consoles, caption = "Consoles")
```

#### What makes this game popular?
- Nostalgia, a new addition to a classic series in Mario Universe
- Features characters from other Nintendo franchises (Link, Animal Crossing, etc.)
- Unique gameplay and customizeable racers
- Smooth graphics and controls
- Cute, whimsical race tracks and beautiful game art

#### Statistics
```{r mariokartstats, echo = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
crit_labels=c("MetaCritic", "OpenCritic", "IGN", "Average Critic Rating")
plot_ly(
  x=c("Critic 1", "Critic 2", "Critic 3", "Average"),
  y=c(data[rank,8], data[rank,9], data[rank,10], data[rank,11]), 
  hovertext = crit_labels, type = "bar", marker = list(color=c("steelblue","steelblue","steelblue", "lightblue"))
) %>% layout(xaxis=cr, yaxis = list(range=c(0,100), title="Rating %"))
plot_ly(type = "pie", marker=list(colors=c("#EADBFF","#C1A1F0")),
               labels=c("Twitch Streamers", "Average Twitch Viewers"), values=c(data[rank,12],data[rank,13]),
               textinfo='label+value')
```

## **Tekken 7**
![](https://thisgengaming.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Tekken-7-title.jpg)

### {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills}
#### Summary
Tekken 7 is a continuation of the Tekken series that follows the story lines of the many characters available to play as. It contains a one-on-one combat system with the cast from the Tekken universe, including the classics like Jin Kazama, Ling Xiaoyu, and Heihachi Mishima. The various displays of martial art styles can be played through both complex and simple combos that are used to defeat opponents either in arcade mode or  local and online co-op.


#### What makes this game popular?
- Unique martial arts styles and gameplay for each character
- Contains downloadable content featuring characters outside of the Tekken universe, such as Noctis Lucis Caelum and Tifa Lockhart from the Final Fantasy series.
- Beautiful graphics and settings true to real life places
- Engaging storylines that continue from previous games in the series
- Customizable characters

Overcooked 2 is a lighthearted game where up to four players prepare food, cook, and deliver meals all under a time crunch. You can play with friends or against them to offer a challenge. Overcooked is a thrilling cooking game where the main enemy is time and your surroundings. The player must know how to navigate the kitchen to either maximize time with their partner, or be incredibly efficient on their own to beat the other player. 

```{r overcookedsum, echo = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
rank = 10
info <- data[rank, c(2,3,15)]
consoles<- data[rank, c(4:7)]
knitr::kable(info, caption = "Additional Info")
knitr::kable(consoles, caption = "Consoles")
```
#### What makes this game popular?
- Adorable, wholesome graphics and animations with a silly story
- Exciting gameplay, especially as a couch co-op game with friends
- Family friendly and a great party game for groups of people
- Addictive gameplay 

#### Statistics
```{r overcookedstats, echo = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
crit_labels=c("MetaCritic", "OpenCritic", "IGN", "Average Critic Rating")
plot_ly(
  x=c("Critic 1", "Critic 2", "Critic 3", "Average"),
  y=c(data[rank,8], data[rank,9], data[rank,10], data[rank,11]), 
  hovertext = crit_labels, type = "bar", marker = list(color=c("steelblue","steelblue","steelblue", "lightblue"))
) %>% layout(xaxis=cr, yaxis = list(range=c(0,100), title="Rating %"))
plot_ly(type = "pie", marker=list(colors=c("#EADBFF","#C1A1F0")),
               labels=c("Twitch Streamers", "Average Twitch Viewers"), values=c(data[rank,12],data[rank,13]),
               textinfo='label+value')
```
